item.title: VOCALOID Cosplay Event at Halloween Cosplay Festival by NicoNico and Animate!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
Niconico and Animate Ltd. are together hosting the “Ikebukuro Halloween Cosplay Festival 2017” which will be held in Ikebukuro East Exit Area Tokyo, Japan from Saturday, Oct. 28th until Sunday, Oct. 29th. This annual event has a plethora of cosplay related activities such as a cosplay fashion show, a cosplay parade, a VOCALOID cosplay gathering, …

The post VOCALOID Cosplay Event at Halloween Cosplay Festival by NicoNico and Animate! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Niconico and Animate Ltd. are together hosting the “Ikebukuro Halloween Cosplay Festival 2017” which will be held in Ikebukuro East Exit Area Tokyo, Japan from Saturday, Oct. 28th until Sunday, Oct. 29th. This annual event has a plethora of cosplay related activities such as a cosplay fashion show, a cosplay parade, a VOCALOID cosplay gathering, photo sessions and more. Participation and viewing is free of charge, and anybody (cosplayers and non-cosplayers) is welcome to join. In addition, people all over the world can also catch the excitement live via Niconico Live Streaming.

About the Festival

The Ikebukuro Halloween Cosplay Festival is an annual event where cosplayers dressed as their favorite anime/video game characters gather to mingle and take part in many activities held throughout the event period. During the festival, the entire town of Ikebukuro becomes its venue; cosplayers are seen on main streets, parks, and even inside stores.

The event began in 2014 with the aim to spread cosplay culture, a famous subculture which originated in Japan, throughout the world from Ikebukuro, one of the epicenters of Japanese subculture. This year marks its 4th year and the event now garners more than 10,000 cosplayers from around the world each year. In 2016, the event attracted approximately 90,000 physical visitors and 240,000 online viewers on Niconico Live Streaming, making this one of the largest cosplay events in Japan. Participation is free and open to everyone – cosplayers and non-cosplaying visitors alike.

The festivities take place at JR Ikebukuro Station East Exit Area – known as an “otaku” subculture mecca with Otome Road as its hub. This year, the event space has been expanded and will include Minami Ikebukuro Park – a park with spacious green lawn for participants to enjoy cosplay photography and open food stalls for refreshments. In addition, the event will be streamed live worldwide via Niconico Live Streaming.

Schedule

There are a ton of events happening the weekend of the festival! Fans in Ikebukuro will have a lot to look forward to doing. And, of course, those tuning into the live stream will have a lot to see all weekend long.

Niconico Live Streaming Schedule

Ikebukuro Halloween Cosplay Festival 2017 – Stage Live Streaming- [DAY 1]

Date: October 28th 10:45~ JST

URL: http://live.nicovideo.jp/watch/lv306994443

Ikebukuro Halloween Cosplay Festival 2017 – Stage Live Streaming- [DAY 2]

Date: October 29th 11:00~ JST

URL: http://live.nicovideo.jp/watch/lv307031877

Main Events

●Niconico Cospllection (Oct.28th & Oct.29th – 11:00~17:00)

Niconico Cospllection, which will be held at the main stage in Higashi Ikebukuro Chuo Park, showcases a plethora of cosplay related activities. These include cosplay fashion shows, cosplay stage performances, cosplay karaoke stage and cosplay arm-wrestling tournaments. Cosplayers selected by the lottery will get a chance to walk the runway and show their cosplay in front of a large audience. Stage guests include cosplayer Miya, Kuroneko, Eiji and Kuroko Kiki.

●Cosplay Parade (Oct.28th 13:00-14:00)

For the first time ever, the festival will hold a cosplay parade. Lead by the Rikkyo University Marching Band, approximately 250 cosplayers chosen from the lottery will march across Sunshine Street to Sunshine 60 Street, which is known to be the busiest street in the area. Viewing is free of charge. However, participation requires a prior application.

●Hatsune Miku 10th Anniversary Ikebukuro Halloween Cosplay Gathering (October 28th 12:00-13:00)

In this special collaboration project, participants cosplaying as the VOCALOID virtual diva Hatsune Miku or Kagamine Rin/Len will all gather in one photo area to celebrate Miku’s 10th anniversary. Anybody cosplaying as a VOCALOID character can take part in this gathering – no prior reservation/application required.

Meeting Spot: In front of the UNIQLO Ikebukuro Sunshine 60 Dori Store

●Cosplay Photography Session (Oct.28th & Oct.29th – 11:00~17:00)

Guests: Iori Moe, Yuriko Tiger, LOPE, Momotsuki Nashiko and Miyamoto Saki
Visitors can get a hands-on experience on cosplay photography with their own camera/smart phone or with a rented high-end DSLR camera provided by Canon Marketing Japan Inc.

●Cosplay Videography Gathering (Oct.29th – 11:00~17:00)

Cosplayers can have their pictures and videos taken professionally by the cosplay videographer Rescue the Princess at Naka Ikebukuro Park. Photos and videos will be uploaded to the official website at a later date.

●Themed Cosplay Gathering (Oct.28th & Oct.29th – 11:00~17:00)

In this program, cosplayers matching a certain “theme” will all gather at Naka Ikebukuro Park to network and take photos.

Special Areas

●Cosplay Photography Area (Oct.28th & Oct.29th – 11:00~17:00)

Dedicated photo spots will be placed in photogenic locations in the venue. This year, an elevated platform will be placed in certain areas broadening the range of expression in cosplay photography.

●Cosplay Prop Area (Oct.28th & Oct.29th – 11:00~17:00)

This area offers handmade cosplay props crafted by skilled modelers from around Japan. Visitors can pose and take photos with memorable weapons and items from anime/manga/game. Located at Naka Ikebukuro Park.

●Cosplay Repair Dock (Oct.28th & Oct.29th – 11:00~17:00)

Cosplay Repair Dock offers cosplay outfit repair service by veteran cosplayers and seamstress. Located at Naka Ikebukuro Park.

Main Timetable

More Information

Dates: October 28th (Sat.) ~ October 29th (Sun.) 10:00-18:00

Main Sponsor: Ikebukuro Halloween Cosplay Festival Executive Committee (niconico / Animate Ltd. )

Co-host: Toshima-ku / Sunshine City

Management and Production: Animate Ltd. / Dwango Co., Ltd. / Hacosta Inc.

Support: acosta! / Cure World Cosplay / COSPLAY MODE / Cosplayer’s Archive / World Cosplay Summit / niconico / Hareza Ikebukuro Developer / Vantan

Participation Fee: Participation and viewing are free of charge.

Cosplay Changing room / Luggage Storage Area: 1000 Yen (tax included)

Official Website: http://ikebukurocosplay.jp/

The post VOCALOID Cosplay Event at Halloween Cosplay Festival by NicoNico and Animate! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Vsinger’s Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest Winners Announced!
item.dc:creator: Louis
item.description:
It’s been more than a month since VNN wrote about Vsinger’s Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest that began in September. On October 17th, BCY Illustration’s channel announced the winners via Weibo: First Prize: Setsuya Second Prize: 米酉昔 Third Prize: 十四栀栀 Bonus Prize: 夕亚人 Winners will not only receive cash as prizes, but also their design will be made into real …

The post Vsinger’s Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest Winners Announced! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
It’s been more than a month since VNN wrote about Vsinger’s Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest that began in September. On October 17th, BCY Illustration’s channel announced the winners via Weibo:

First Prize: Setsuya

Second Prize: 米酉昔

Third Prize: 十四栀栀

Bonus Prize: 夕亚人

Winners will not only receive cash as prizes, but also their design will be made into real costumes and sold at 漫有引力AScosing‘s Tmall store. Winners will receive a shared revenue of ¥5 RMB for each costume sold on AScosing’s Taobao shop within six months after their design is made into a costume. If you are interested to see more designs in the contest, feel free to check on the event page here.

Did any of these beautiful dresses catch your attention? If so, it’s time to save your money and wait for them to be on your winter shopping wishlist!

The post Vsinger’s Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest Winners Announced! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: Vsinger Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest!
item.dc:creator: Monds
item.description:
On the 12th, the BCY Illustration channel made an announcement on their Weibo that they were collaborating with “漫有引力AScosing” to host a contest, which was officially authorized by Vsinger. The BCY Illustration channel announced a Vsinger autumn and winter design contest has started. It will be similar to the last contest, “VSinger Characters Spring Costume Design Contest”. …

The post Vsinger Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
On the 12th, the BCY Illustration channel made an announcement on their Weibo that they were collaborating with “漫有引力AScosing” to host a contest, which was officially authorized by Vsinger. The BCY Illustration channel announced a Vsinger autumn and winter design contest has started. It will be similar to the last contest, “VSinger Characters Spring Costume Design Contest”. However, this time, you must submit at least two designs in order to be qualified to enter.

Rules
  1. Adult content, pornography or any violence or content that goes against the laws of the People’s Republic of China will be disqualified.
  2. The theme must be based off “Vsingers autumn and winter designs;” all other themes will be disqualified.
  3. The characters are limited to Luo Tianyi, Yuezheng Ling, YANHE, and Mo Qingxian. You may create multiple characters, however, you must create at least two.
  4. You may pick the “Harvest time” or “Winter palace” theme. You may choose one theme in which the characters must stick to the same theme and be related to one another. You are free to make your own design, however the two must be linked to one another.
  5. The designs must be colored. The design color scheme must be based off the VOCALOID’s supporting color (ex: Tianyi = blue); the outfit design style is not limited, however.
  6. Body proportions should range between 7 heads tall and 8 heads tall.
  7. Entries must be submitted by the contestant, and there are no limits on the amount of images per artwork. Any images with a watermark will not be accepted with the exception of the original logos.
  8. If your artwork has been submitted in another contest, you may not enter using that same image. Do not plagiarize works from other artists or you will be disqualified from the contest.
  9. The winners will be judged by Vsinger.

How to Join

  • To enter the contest, contestant will need to register a BCY account.
  • Enter the event page：http://bcy.net/huodong/73
  • Click on the “我要参加” (I want to join) red button, it will lead you to the submission page. Fill up the required information including title, fandom (Vsinger) and character. Upload the artwork and make sure you insert the correct event tag “Vsinger服装设计” (Vsinger Costume Design) before click on “发布” (submit).
Event Times

Submission dates begin on September 12th, 2016, and end on October 10th, 2016. The review phase begins on October 11th, 2016, and ends on October 15th, 2016. Winners will be announced on October 16th, 2016.

Prizes

Once the products have been produced, the award-winning artist will receive an official honorary certificate from Vsinger and bonus from the shared revenue.

  • First prize: ¥5000 RMB ($750 USD)
  • Second prize: ¥3000 RMB ($450 USD)
  • Third prize: ¥2000 RMB ($300 USD)
  • Bonus prize: ¥1000 RMB ($150 USD)

*Requires more than 2 characters to enter the selection stage.

*Shared revenue: Winners will receive ¥5 RMB for each costume sold on AScosing’s Taobao shop within six months after their design is made into a costume and put on the shelf in AScosing’s Taobao shop.

*Multiple contributions will only be awarded once.

Other Information

Event page: http://bcy.net/huodong/73

Detailed rules and prizes: http://bcy.net/daily/detail/377292

Vsinger’s VOCALOID Spring Costume Design Contest Winners

Check out our article on the previous contest here. The previous winners have been sold on Taobao.

“镜花水月” (Flower in the Mirror) Set

As seen below, you can see the quality of the cosplays. They have also included some jewelry. Shoes and bustle need to be bought separately. The shirt in “Mo Qing Xian’s style 镜花水月” needs to be purchased separately as well.

You can get the 镜花水月 cosplay set on Taobao.

“花之音” (Music of Flower) Set

In the “花之音 · Luo Tianyi” set, hair accessories as well as jewelry are included, such as a bracelet, beret, badge, and socks. The wig and shoes are not included. Similar to the above, the content of “花之音 · 言和” is the same as Tianyi’s design, with the exception of an extra jacket (wig and socks not included).

You can get the “花之音” cosplay set on Taobao.

 

The post Vsinger Autumn and Winter Cosplay Design Contest! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: A Look Into the Most Magical of Worlds: Magical Mirai 2016 Cosplayer Close-up Video Will Leave You in Absolute Bliss
item.dc:creator: marumain
item.description:
Last week, the massive-scale Miku event Magical Mirai 2016 was held at Makuhari Messe. Among the attendees was someone who took the liberty of filming the many cosplayers present, and creating a video to upload on YouTube for the whole world to see and be in awe at. Before beginning, first cast aside any and …

The post A Look Into the Most Magical of Worlds: Magical Mirai 2016 Cosplayer Close-up Video Will Leave You in Absolute Bliss appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Last week, the massive-scale Miku event Magical Mirai 2016 was held at Makuhari Messe. Among the attendees was someone who took the liberty of filming the many cosplayers present, and creating a video to upload on YouTube for the whole world to see and be in awe at.

Before beginning, first cast aside any and all preconceptions or fore-thoughts you may have about them, and then enjoy the embedded video below!

So, what do you think? This video was created by Mkdy Film Works, who called out to the many cosplayers at Magical Mirai, making sure that they were fine with being filmed for a video using royalty-free and YouTube-approved music. The video first shows a Miku cosplayer with a smile that can light up a room, all to some splendidly soothing music. Then it takes a sharp turn with some really upbeat background music playing as six different VOCALOID cosplayers are shown walking about from various shot angles.

Besides highlighting the immense talent and beauty of these cosplayers, the video also showcases the many figures, dolls, display items, itasha, and more from the exhibition area, interweaving their splendor along with some cute and charming Miku displays into a masterpiece of a walkthrough video that will leave you in absolute bliss upon finishing it. If you know someone to whom you wish to impart your fondest memories from Magical Mirai, show them this video, and they’ll surely become enthralled with the experience too. By all means, share this video with all around you!

 

MAGICAL MIRAI 2016 EXHIBITION / COSPLAY SHOWCASE / マジカルミライ企画展 https://t.co/bQFUs7rYB2 #マジカルミライ

— たけくる＠TGS日曜だけ (@huskymoto) 2016年9月14日

Special Thanks: Mkdy Film Works

  • High-quality Version of the Video (Redirects to Vimeo)
  • Mkdy Film Works’ Youtube
  • Mkdy Film Works’ Twitter

The post A Look Into the Most Magical of Worlds: Magical Mirai 2016 Cosplayer Close-up Video Will Leave You in Absolute Bliss appeared first on VNN.

item.title: VOCALOID News Network at Otakuthon 2016 Recap
item.dc:creator: Luna
item.description:
Hello everyone! As you may have known, I (Luna from VNN French) had the (last minute) privilege to attend the annual Otakuthon from August 5th to 7th in Montréal, Canada. It was my first time going to a convention and I must say, while I was mostly excited, I was pretty nervous about what would …

The post VOCALOID News Network at Otakuthon 2016 Recap appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Hello everyone! As you may have known, I (Luna from VNN French) had the (last minute) privilege to attend the annual Otakuthon from August 5th to 7th in Montréal, Canada. It was my first time going to a convention and I must say, while I was mostly excited, I was pretty nervous about what would happen during the weekend. However, after such an amazing event, if I can go back again next year then I totally will go. Now to roll with the events of Otakuthon!

 

Merchandise

My first stop was the Exhibition Hall on the 2nd floor. In there were the Artists’ Area and the Dealers’ Area. The Artists’ Area regrouped many artists who were selling some amazing arts and crafts they made, from anime to video games. There were a few (if not rare) VOCALOID items, but unfortunately I was able to find only one artist who allowed me to take pictures of their VOCALOID products, as the others restricted photographs. For the Dealers’ Area, photographs of the merchandise were actually prohibited by the convention, so I was unable to take pictures there except at the 1st Place Booth who granted me permission (read more in the paragraph below). Good Smile Company also had a booth to present and sell its beautiful figures.

1st Place’s Booth

Also in the Dealers’ Area was 1st Place’s booth. They were selling IA merchandise such as shirts, keychains, pins/buttons, CDs/DVDs, merch of her concert, and Kagerou Project items. A TV was showing different clips and music videos of IA and ONE. There were also three PS Vitas with the game IA/VT Colorful available for the public to play as a demo before deciding whether or not they’ll buy it. The copies of the game were sold pretty fast; within a few hours on the first day, they were already sold out! I was a bit disappointed but glad to have at least tried a few songs in the demo. The game is pretty similar in concept and design to the Project Diva series, since both are rhythm games.

Screenings of “IA’s 1st Live Concert -PARTY A GO GO-“

I attended the screenings of “IA’s 1st Live Concert -PARTY A GO GO-” on Saturday and Sunday. Many VOCALOID fans were present at both screenings and were cheering after every song. Some went to the point of waving their glow sticks like the fans in the video. Of course, the screenings weren’t of the full concert, but they did show IA singing some quite popular songs in the VOCALOID community, such as “Setsuna Drive” and “Outer Science” (from Kagerou Project). I enjoyed both screenings. It made me want to be able to go to an actual VOCALOID concert. Hopefully soon!

IA Workshop

On Saturday evening, I went to the IA workshop. The room was full of people who were interested to see how IA works with VOCALOID 3. Although, there were only six computers available for about a hundred people, so not everybody was able to play with the software due to the staff not expecting such high numbers. If you’ve already played with a software similar to VOCALOID, such as UTAU, then you shouldn’t have any problem understanding the mechanics. The person hosting the panel was not really used to conducting presentations and it was a bit obvious by his mannerism. He seemed nervous and couldn’t really answer the audience’s questions properly. That unfortunately didn’t help the many people in the room who never had any experience with the software. Some people even left the panel earlier than intended. It also didn’t help that the workshop was presented at 10 PM. Overall, it was an okay experience. I did have to restrain myself from buying the software and the voice bank as I already didn’t have a lot of money on me for the con.

Cosplay

To my biggest surprise, VOCALOID cosplayers were a bit “rare” at Otakuthon this year. I was seriously expecting more, but I was still able to spot out some cute and awesome cosplays, with Hatsune Miku being the one who was the most cosplayed.

Other Events

Besides the IA events and the workshop, there were a few panels that caught my attention, especially the ones with the anime YouTubers who were the special guests of the weekend. Misty Chronexia, The Anime Man, akidearest, and Lost Pause hosted a panel per day all three days, as well as signing sessions for the fans. All three panels were focused mainly on YouTube and anime. They talked about their career path, gave us tips on how to “work” on YouTube, their favorite anime, etc. There were so many people who wanted to meet them after every panel (easily over 200 people) that they had to call security many times to escort them! All four YouTubers have mentioned during their panels that they’re considering to make Otakuthon a yearly event, so if you missed the chance to meet them, be sure to follow Otakuthon next year to get more information.

Conclusion

Of course, Otakuthon isn’t only about VOCALOID. Everything I have mentioned in this article is just a fraction of the whole convention. A Cosplay Café, video gaming room (in which they had a little Project Diva tournament on the 5th), trading card games hall, the traditional Otakudance… there were so many events I wished I could have gone to, including the annual Masquerade, the BACK-ON concert, etc. Overall, Otakuthon doesn’t focus simply on one aspect of the Japanese culture. It gives access to everyone who enjoys any side of Japanese culture. If you want to live the experience of a con, Otakuthon is one of these events that you don’t want to miss.

Hope to see everyone next year at Otakuthon 2017!

The post VOCALOID News Network at Otakuthon 2016 Recap appeared first on VNN.

item.title: VOCALOID News Network at Otakon!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
We’ve been talking about it for a while but now we’ve got the article! VNN will be at Otakon! Of course, we’re not the only VOCALOID related goodness going on this weekend. We’ll be hanging out with EmpathP, who has two panels, and we’ll even be attending the VOCALOTAKON photo shoot! Here’s our plans of …

The post VOCALOID News Network at Otakon! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
We’ve been talking about it for a while but now we’ve got the article! VNN will be at Otakon! Of course, we’re not the only VOCALOID related goodness going on this weekend. We’ll be hanging out with EmpathP, who has two panels, and we’ll even be attending the VOCALOTAKON photo shoot! Here’s our plans of operation for VOCALOID News Network at Otakon!

EmpathP’s Panels

EmpathP is hosting two panels this weekend, one on Saturday morning and one on Sunday morning. Expect to see VNN there for both. Unfortunately, VNN doesn’t have any panels at Otakon this year.

The World of Vocaloid with EmpathP

Date: Saturday, August 13, 2016
Time: 11:30 AM – 12:30 PM
Location: AMV Theater (BCC 324-326)

“VOCALOID is a synthetic vocal software developed by Yamaha that has broken down the music barriers in Japan. At this panel you will learn the origins of the VOCALOID Program from its humble beginnings to its limitless future in the world of music production.”

Behind the Scenes with English Vocaloids

Date: Sunday, August 14, 2016
Time: 11:30 AM – 12:30 PM
Location: Panel 3 (BCC 337-338)

“Vocaloid has become a staple of Japanese music Culture. However, few are aware that the technology’s humble origins lie in the western regions of the world. At this panel you will learn about beginnings of English Vocaloids and their unlimited future.”

Other Panels

MikuMikuMusicVideos

Date: Friday, August 12, 2016
Time: 1:45 PM – 2:45 PM
Location: AMV Theater (BCC 324-326)

“AMV Theater-run event. An hour of everyone’s favorite virtual idols dancing, rocking out, playing volleyball, and defending their homes from invading ninjas.”

Photo Shoot

In addition to the panels, there’s an official VOCALOID photo shoot as well! Anyone cosplaying VOCALOIDs or UTAUs can head to the VOCALOTAKON photo shoot on Saturday. Or, you can be like VNN and just be there to take pictures. The event will take place on Saturday at 6:30 PM and will last until 7:30 PM. It’ll be located on the third floor terrace. For those unfamiliar with the Baltimore Convention Center, we have a visual available below.

You can find the VOCALOTAKON event on Facebook here.

Goodies!

Monds and I (Hoshi) are going all out for Otakon. We have over 200 pins to give away featuring all of our banner characters. You can get Miku, Luo Tianyi, Xin Hua, Stardust, IA, MAIKA, AVANNA, UNI, SeeU, MAYU, Vivi, and En pins! We have about 20 of each to give away. Since we don’t have any panels of our own, you’ll have to find us to get some!

Bookmarks

In addition to the standard pins, we also have a limited amount of bookmarks to give away. We have three different designs that each feature some of our banner characters. These are limited to one per person due to the quantity.

The bookmark on the left features Vivi, En, and IA.

The middle bookmark features Miku, MAYU, Luo Tianyi, SeeU, and AVANNA.

And the right bookmark features Tianyi, Xin Hua, Stardust, MAIKA, and UNI.

The bookmarks have the designs on the front and back, and are made of rather sturdy material. However, they can still bend and aren’t laminated, so do be careful with them.

Special Prize

Finally, we have an extra special treat for five lucky VNN fans. While we’ll have tons of pins and quite a few bookmarks, we’ll also have limited to five of this special prize. What is it, you ask? None other than Anime Expo 2011 posters featuring Miku!

These won’t come easy, however, and are reserved for VNN fans only. How do you get one? Well, it’s not so simple.

First, you have to find me, Hoshi. I’ll be carrying around a grey poster container as long as I have the posters. You’ll be looking for a girl wearing a VIP Miku Expo watch as well as either a VNN or VOCALOID related shirt. Follow me on Twitter @VocaHoshi as I’ll be posting what I’m wearing (and when I run out of posters) so you know how to find me.

Next, you have to let me know you follow VNN and specifically ask about the posters. Please don’t be rude, though. Just something like “Hey, are you Hoshi?” to confirm it’s me and then “Do you still have the Anime Expo posters?”, and you’re good to go to the next step.

Finally, here’s the hard part. These guys aren’t going to be given away for free. Instead, you’re going to have to complete a challenge. I may ask a trivia question, I may tell you to name x amount of VOCALOIDs in a certain amount of time, or I may pull something else VOCALOID related out of my hat. Don’t worry, though. It won’t be anything crazy. I just want to see how big of a VOCALOID fan you are.

Pass the challenge and the poster is yours!

 

We hope to see lots of VOCALOID fans at Otakon! Even if you’re not interested in the goodies, come by and say hi! You’ll be able to find us via our VNN or other VOCALOID shirts (Monds has both IA and ONE shirts, and I have a few Miku ones as well as a Team Flufferpuffer shirt). Don’t forget to be on the lookout for EmpathP as we’ll be spending quite a bit of time with her.

The post VOCALOID News Network at Otakon! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: VOCALOID News Network Recap of Anime Expo 2016
item.dc:creator: Cowfee
item.description:
Hello, I’m Cowfee, the head editor of VOCALOID News Network! Last week from Friday to Monday (July 1st-4th), I was able to attend the largest anime convention in the world known as Anime Expo, located in Los Angeles, California. Though I’m certainly no stranger to AX and its chaotic, crowded ways, this was the first …

The post VOCALOID News Network Recap of Anime Expo 2016 appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Hello, I’m Cowfee, the head editor of VOCALOID News Network! Last week from Friday to Monday (July 1st-4th), I was able to attend the largest anime convention in the world known as Anime Expo, located in Los Angeles, California. Though I’m certainly no stranger to AX and its chaotic, crowded ways, this was the first time I would be representing VNN there, albeit under short notice. As a result, I was even more exhausted (if possible) than I was last year, but those four fateful days were also the most fun I have ever had! This is the one convention you absolutely cannot miss attending at least once in your life if you’re an avid fan of anime (and VOCALOID!), but I digress. Now, where do I start?

Lia and IA

As we announced in a previous article, Lia joined this year’s convention as the acclaimed “Guest of Honour” along with IA, the popular 1st Place VOCALOID she voiced for. The famous singer appeared in various events and panels over the weekend, including the Welcoming Ceremony, IA screening, her own signing session, and the Masquerade. Unfortunately, I could not get into the IA concert screening due to an attendance cap (not enough room), but I checked out the 1st Place booth several times nearly every day to marvel over the television screening of some of IA’s live performances, merchandise of Lia and IA (including Kagerou Project), and the hordes of fans that would come over to visit daily. The setup was very similar to last year’s booth, but with a lot more Lia!

Speaking of Lia, her autographing session was held at the 1st Place booth located in Exhibit Hall on Sunday. However, opportunity was extremely limited due to the singer’s busy schedule, so only the first 50 customers who purchased one or more of her featured albums from the booth would receive a pass to be able to attend. Luckily enough, I was number 48 of the lot, but later learned that the cap was increased to accommodate 20 to 30 more others in response to the sheer amount of demand. Once my turn came up, it was a dream come true. Being able to meet Lia in person and have her sign my merchandise (IA/03 -VISION- and Lia*COLLECTION ALBUM Vol.2「Crystal Voice」) was so nerve-wracking that I completely forgot to ask for a picture! Fortunately, I would gain another chance later that day when I was offered the amazing opportunity to interview her.

The interview with Lia was conducted in English, as she knew and spoke the language well, most likely from her time in the United States where she went to college. Because she would be preparing for the Masquerade soon, I was only given 15 minutes, but that was more than enough time to sate my curiosity about her experience with IA, as well as share plenty of laughs and pleasantly surprising moments with the charming vocalist. Needless to say, I’m highly honoured to have been able to meet and speak with Lia. You can read the entire interview on our website here.

Everything VOCALOID!

While the only panels/events of VOCALOID was the IA screening, Artist Alley, Exhibit Hall, and Entertainment Hall were bursting with the fandom everywhere you looked. This year, I did not explore Artist Alley as much as I would have liked, but during the short periods when I had, there was plenty of VOCALOID fan art by the multitude of talented artists featured there. Unsurprisingly, Hatsune Miku was the main depicted star, with the rest of the Cryptonloids popping up occasionally. I had to restrain myself from purchasing a print of Miku in the guise of an adorable artist herself. Due to a majority of artists who requested not to take pictures, however, I respected their privacy and did not take any. If you’re curious though, this year’s Artist Alley was relocated to the lower level parking lots (called Kentia Hall) instead of near the back of Exhibit Hall as it had been years prior. This is due to the increase of attendees (nearly 100,000 people), and thus, the need for expansion. The Autographs and Table Top Gaming sections were also placed there.

In my personal opinion, Exhibit Hall is where the REAL fun begins! And by fun I mean sore feet, getting squished a little too close with strangers, keeping a constant radar for freebies, and sitting down for a rest next to a sign that clearly states NOT to sit down. Having spent most of my time here, I took pictures of absolutely everything. It’s no exaggeration when I say that almost every booth featured something VOCALOID (usually of Miku). Plushies, figures, posters, games – you name it! The teal twin-tailed diva painted the room with her presence. A few highlights I will focus on though are the Miku Expo skate decks and the official Hatsune Miku cosplay outfit.

“MIKU EXPO Digital Stars” Skate Decks

If you’ve been to Miku Expo 2016 or keeping up-to-date, Hobby Stock Skate Boards (HSSB) created two stunning skate decks for the “MIKU EXPO Digital Stars” event. They held an exhibition at AX, displaying and selling the breath-taking designs by MONQ and KANZAKIHIRO. Under the limelight, skateboarders, VOCALOID fans, and Miku cosplayers alike all flocked to the display to bask in the glory. I’m certain that many admirers wished they could skateboard for the sake of acquiring the rare beauties, myself included.

Official Hatsune Miku Cosplay Outfit

During the last day of the con (Monday, July 4th), I almost completely missed the Fine Horse Workshop booth. Sure glad that I didn’t, because there they were announcing the release of an officially licensed Hatsune Miku cosplay outfit! Complete with sound-activated luminescent sleeves, working headphones able to take calls, and a tie that can be loosened by just pulling downwards (very important!), all in one immaculate, comfy replica that perfectly covers every little detail from the original, Miku cosplayers are in for the biggest treat of their lives! I was able to test out the headphones for myself, and even though I don’t cosplay, the idea is starting to sound very tempting. Pre-order dates and price information will be released sometime this month, so be sure to keep on the lookout by following their updates on Facebook.

On a side note, Hatsune Miku: Project DIVA X, Hatsune Miku×Dollfie Dream, and Snow Miku 2016 exhibitions were also there!

Not to be left out, Entertainment Hall kept true to its name and kept hordes of people entertained every day and night. Aside from the famous cosplay sites and gaming area, Goodsmile Racing debuted a gigantic gallery of Figma Racing Miku 2016, along with its past successful years! (I was drooling over the Megurine Luka vehicle for quite a while.) Enjoy the tour for yourself!

Youtaite Gathering

First off, if you’re unaware of what “Youtaites” or “utaites” are, they refer to singers who cover mostly VOCALOID (anime, J-POP, K-POP, etc.) songs and upload them online to video streaming websites, such as YouTube and Niconico. The community has been growing rapidly during the past few years, and members often learn and have skills in not only singing but also mixing, animating, and much more. Being quite the collaborative and social group, members quickly make life-long friends and wish to meet each other offline. Through this, the annual Youtaite Meet-Up at Anime Expo was born, and this year on Saturday saw to the largest turnout ever — counting well over 50 people, with the youngest being just 11-years-old!

Similar to last year’s gathering, the group started off with icebreakers to introduce everyone to each other. However, because there were so many people this time, name tags were distributed and everyone was separated into six different smaller groups to conduct the activities. After getting to know our group, a competition was held between the groups through the game “Heads Up” where someone holds a word on their forehead and has to guess what it is by asking questions while the others attempt to help him/her without giving the word away. Towards the end of the gathering, everyone took group pictures and mingled among themselves, either meeting new people or uniting with old friends. This year’s was extremely fun, and I already look forward to seeing how the next one will play out!

Cosplay

When you’re at a convention, cosplay is a must-have! As anime and the likes are widely loved for their characters, it’s no surprise that the majority of the fans there would be dressed up and ready to pose for the camera. VOCALOID is no exception, and with the fandom still steadily on the rise, two cosplay gatherings were held on Sunday and Monday. While I was formally invited to attend the one on Sunday by the organizers (whom I met more than once during the con), unfortunately, I was unable to find it! Told that it would be held at Site 5, I spent more than an hour walking around the proposed area at the appointed time but only found a few other cosplayers as confused as I was. Thank goodness I had asked a fellow co-worker who would be attending the gathering in advance to take as many pictures as he could for me. According to him, it turns out that they had started at Site 5 but later moved to an area south of it, most likely due to overcrowding. As for the gathering on Monday, I was preoccupied with various other things and could not make it.

Anyways, here are just a few of the HUNDREDS of photos taken of the oh-so lovely cosplayers, with their consent and permission to post on the site, of course. (Photos provided by Agatechlo.)

Conclusion

We covered quite a bit through this recap, though it’s not even half of the experience overall that can only be found at Anime Expo. Although VOCALOID and all else related was what I could focus on and talk about here, the con is so much more than that and provides an endless venue of anime, cartoons, games, Japanese culture, K-POP — nearly everything a nerd can think of! Plus, you’re bound to run into celebrities more often than not (I had the privilege of meeting LilyPichu, Yoshi Sudarso, and cast members of Fresh Off the Boat, just to name a few)!

As always, I had an absolutely exciting adventure here this year and already look forward to the next one. If you can, I strongly recommend and urge everyone who may have just the slimmest chance of attending this con in the future to go. Can’t wait to see you guys next year!

The post VOCALOID News Network Recap of Anime Expo 2016 appeared first on VNN.

item.title: IA English Website Now Available!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
An IA English website is now available thanks to 1st Place! Currently, the site is dedicated to IA’s World Screening Caravan. You can see the schedule, access the screening questionnaire, and even visit IA’s artist page (the artist page is only in Japanese at the moment). The website also promises that more information is coming …

The post IA English Website Now Available! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
An IA English website is now available thanks to 1st Place! Currently, the site is dedicated to IA’s World Screening Caravan. You can see the schedule, access the screening questionnaire, and even visit IA’s artist page (the artist page is only in Japanese at the moment). The website also promises that more information is coming soon.

You can visit the website here: http://1stplace.co.jp/ia/eng/

In addition, the choker campaign mentioned in our previous article is also up! Fans can submit small bits of information and receive the pattern for IA’s outfit. If you cosplay IA at an event that 1st PLACE is at, you can receive IA’s choker for free from the company!

Fans can go to the form here and enter their email address to have the patterns sent right to their inbox. Unfortunately, the patterns have Japanese instructions on them at the moment.

The post IA English Website Now Available! appeared first on VNN.

item.title: More “IA PARTY A GO-GO” Locations Announced!
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
The “IA PARTY A GO-GO” World Screening Caravan started on January 27th with IA’s 4th anniversary event held in Tokyo. After that, the movie toured France, Spain, Canada, Mexico, and the next date is at Fan Expo Dallas, to be held on June 3rd to 5th at the Dallas Convention Center. On Saturday the 4th …

The post More “IA PARTY A GO-GO” Locations Announced! appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
The “IA PARTY A GO-GO” World Screening Caravan started on January 27th with IA’s 4th anniversary event held in Tokyo. After that, the movie toured France, Spain, Canada, Mexico, and the next date is at Fan Expo Dallas, to be held on June 3rd to 5th at the Dallas Convention Center. On Saturday the 4th from 7 PM, visitors can enjoy the movie in the hall C149. Moreover, “1st PLACE Official Shop” is welcoming you at booth #164 with official merchandise, and CDs of IA and “Kagerou Project“, the work of multi-talented creator Jin.

Fan Expo Dallas 2016
Jun 3rd FRI, 4-9 PM/Jun 4th SAT, 10 AM – 7 PM/Jun 5th SUN, 10 AM – 5 PM
DALLAS CONVENTION CENTER
Screening info:
June 4th SAT, 7-8 PM in hall “C149”
1st PLACE Official Shop, Booth #164
Fan Expo Dallas official website: http://fanexpodallas.com/

Screenings in Mexico

The full 110 min. live movie version can be appreciated at the Mexican-Japanese movie festival AniFest from June 25th to July 10th. The movie concert will be screened in 30 theaters around the whole country, and IA is saying hi to her Mexican fans in Spanish for the first time in the movie trailer!
Hear it yourself!

About Anifest

Dates: June 25th–26th/July 2nd-3rd/July 9th–10th
Theaters:

Y AQUÍ LAS SEDES!!!#ANIFEST Junio 25-26 Julio 2-3, 9-10TRAILER https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VdCXGIxi6Fw

Posted by AniFest on Tuesday, May 31, 2016

Trailers:

Trailer AniFest verano 2016

Por fin!! Las fechas de este AniFest de Verano 2016 son reveladas!!Publicaremos las sedes en una hora, para que disfruten el trailer ;PSushi Police, K: Missing Kings, IA Party A Go Go the Movie y Gurren Lagann: Childhood’s End (Gurren Hen) dan vida y color a este festival de verano. Un dato importante: Gurren Lagann: Childhood’s end es la primera parte de dos y esperamos que con su apoyo en la taquilla del festival, podamos llevar a cabo en noviembre Gurren Lagann: The Lights in the Sky are Stars (Laggan hen) segunda parte de esta asombrosa historia en pantalla grande!!

Posted by AniFest on Tuesday, May 31, 2016

Official Page:

https://www.facebook.com/AniFestMX

Other Events and Screenings

More screenings will be held in Catania (Italy), The Hague (Netherlands), Paris (France), London (U.K.), San Francisco (U.S.), San José (Costa Rica), Bangkok (Thailand), and many other places. Furthermore, IA has been chosen as the Godmother and testimonial of the festival “Kamen Fest” held in San José (Costa Rica) at Estadio Nacional de Costa Rica this summer.

In addition, many events will accompany the world screening tour. Among them, don’t miss the “IA official choker campaign”! Download the cosplay pattern for free here and go to the 1st PLACE booth in the events worldwide. You’ll be gifted with IA’s choker!

You can follow IA’s World Screening Tour on Instagram. Stay tuned!

“IA PARTY A GO-GO” World Screening Caravan Schedule（June〜August 2016）

June 2nd (THUR) – 5th (SUN)
ETNA COMICS @Italy/Centro Fieristico Le Ciminiere
Booth: JAPAN CENTRE “EC6”
Screening schedule:
・June 2nd (THURS) 16:20 [location] Anfiteatro Palco Principale
・June 3rd (FRI) 12:30, June 4th (SAT) 12:30, June 5th (SUN) 12:30 [location] Sala conferenze del Japan Center

FAN EXPO DALLAS @DALLAS CONVENTION CENTER
Screening schedule: June 4th (SAT) 19:00 – 20:00 [location] C149
Booth: No.164
URL: www.fanexpodallas.com

June 10th (FRI) – 12th(SUN)
ANIMECON @The Hague/World Forum, The Netherlands
Screening schedule: June 10th (FRI) 21:30 – 22:20 [location] Mississippi
URL: www.animecon.nl

June 19th (SUN)
Animate Bangkok
Screening schedule: [time] 17:00 [location] MBK cinema

June 25th (SAT) – July 10th (SUN)

URL: https://www.facebook.com/AniFestMX　

July 7th (THURS) – 10th (SUN)

item.title: Piapro Character Themed OMAKASE Box Item Revealed
item.dc:creator: Hoshi
item.description:
Viewster recently revealed the next item in the Piapro character themed OMAKASE box. While the box was announced some time ago, we've been waiting for a few item reveals before reporting on it. Subscriptions must be in by March 23rd and the boxes are set to start shipping on March 25th.

Announced Items

Currently, there

The post Piapro Character Themed OMAKASE Box Item Revealed appeared first on VNN.
item.content:encoded:
Viewster recently revealed the next item in the Piapro character themed OMAKASE box. While the box was announced some time ago, we’ve been waiting for a few item reveals before reporting on it. Subscriptions must be in by March 23rd and the boxes are set to start shipping on March 25th.

Announced Items

Currently, there are two great items announced for this box with many more yet to be seen. We have a Miku t-shirt illustrated by HappyMappy, and a Rin and Len cosplay belt based on their V2 designs. While these are the only announced items, we’re promised work from 14 artists featuring all of the Crypton owned Piapro characters. Whether it’s Miku, Luka, Rin, Len, KAITO, or MEIKO, there will be something in the box for every Crypton fan.

Miku T-Shirt

The t-shirt was designed by OMAKASE, illustrated by HappyMappy, and created by WeLoveFine. While it was available in the alpha OMAKASE box, it’s made its return in a baby blue color for this special Piapro themed box.

Kagamine Cosplay Belt and Loop

The next item is a huge plus for any Kagamine fan. Anyone who preordered the Hatsune Miku: Project Mirai DX game remembers the wallet chain that came with it was based on the signature belt loop from Miku’s V2 design. Now because of Viewster, Kagamine fans can not only get a Kagamine colored belt loop but also an actual belt to go with it!

From the looks of it, the belt will be adjustable so fans of many (we won’t say all just in case) sizes can show their Kagamine love.

Pro-tip from Viewster: wear your belt right-side-up to sport Rin’s style, or upside-down for Len’s!

 

Artists Involved

Omakase has listed many artists who will be involved in this box, including but not limited to Punimelt, Alex Ahad, and Miss Kika. Fourteen artists in total will be participating in this box. For the full list, please see Viewster’s blog.

Ordering Information

To subscribe to the OMAKASE box, visit the official website here. You can enter the code “MIKU10” for 10% off the price of the box, which is usually $29 USD. Remember that subscriptions must be in by March 23rd!

Unfortunately, Viewster recently announced that the OMAKASE subscription box will be ending after the Crypton box.

 

Sources: “First Exclusive Hatsune Miku Item Revealed!“, “New Exclusive Merch Revealed!“

The post Piapro Character Themed OMAKASE Box Item Revealed appeared first on VNN.
